titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 3773) to amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to establish a procedure for authorizing certain acquisitions of foreign intelligence, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 3773) to amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to establish a procedure for authorizing certain acquisitions of foreign intelligence, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-549, by Mr. Arcuri.

The resolution waives all points of order against the motion except those arising under clause 10 of rule XXI. Upon the adoption of the resolution it shall be in order to move that the House agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 3773 with an amendment.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 197.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1041.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 190 (Roll no. 143).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 188 (Roll no. 144).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 3773 (Responsible Electronic Surveillance That is Overseen, Reviewed, and Effective Act of 2007 or RESTORE Act of 2007).
